Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the potential harm of getting a flu shot by stating that it is "poisoning yourself."
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide any evidence or sources to support its assertion that flu shots contain harmful ingredients.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the ingredients mentioned in the Facebook post are actually present in flu shots, without providing any evidence or verifying the accuracy of the information.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the overwhelming consensus among medical experts that flu shots are safe and effective.
Understate: There is no evidence of any bias of understating in the claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of any bias of faltering at times in the claim.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no evidence of any bias of alternative explanation in the claim.
